properties.Name: Altadena Substation (#8)
properties.description: 2245 N. Lake Ave, Altadena. Built in 1905, this brick building provided power until 1941 to various Pasadena and Altadena PE lines, as well as the Mt. Lowe Railway. It is an unoccupied office building today.

properties.Name: Burlington Substation (#36)
properties.description: 1147 West Venice Boulevard, Los Angeles. Provided electric power for Venice Short Line and other lines on Venice Blvd. Â Now Avila's Auto Upholstery shop.

properties.Name: Ivy Substation (#39)
properties.description: 9070 Venice Blvd, Culver City. Built in 1907, this structure provided electric power to Pacific Electric's Santa Monica Air Line, Redondo Beach Line and Venice Short Line until 1953. In the 1990s. Culver City renovated the structure, which is home to The Actor's Gang theatre company.

properties.Name: Los Nietos Substation (#10)
properties.description: 8851 Dice Road, Santa Fe Springs. This building, re-built in 1928, provided electric power until 1938 to the PE Whittier and Yorba Linda lines. Can be seen from Norwalk Blvd along the former Whittier Line tracks south of Perkins Ave. Currently part of the Phibro Tech manufacturing facility.

properties.Name: North Hollywood Substation (#30)
properties.description: 4475 Vineland Avenue, North Hollywood. Built 1911. Electric substation providing electric power to San Fernando Valley line. Now an office building called, "The Howard Colonial."

properties.Name: Olive Substation (#35)
properties.description: 2798 Sunset Blvd, Silver Lake. This building was the Olive Substation, supplying electric power to the various lines that ran along Sunset Blvd. After the PE, it had functioned as an architect's studio and is currently the offices for Epitaph Records.

properties.Name: Pasadena Substation (#2)
properties.description: 1144 Fair Oaks Ave, Pasadena. This electric substation provided electric power to PE's various lines in Pasadena. Now part of Pasadena Water and Power's main electric station property.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Substation (#14)
properties.description: 420 N. Lacey St (originally 802 E. 5th Street -- street no longer exists), Santa Ana. Built in 1907, this building provided electrical power for the PE's Watts-Santa Ana Line, the Santa Ana-Orange Line and the Santa Ana-Huntington Beach Line until 1960. It is the last remaining Pacific Electric substation in Orange County.

properties.Name: Toluca Substation (#51)
properties.description: 1304 W 2nd St, Westlake. Served as an electric power substation for the subway and the Glendale-Burbank lines from 1925-1955. Located behind the Belmont Station Apartments complex, accessible from Toluca Street.

properties.Name: Vineland Substation (#21)
properties.description: 14811 Badillo Street, Baldwin Park. Built in 1906, this structure provided electric power to the PE's San Bernardino Line trains until 1950. Can be seen from the Metrolink Baldwin Park station satellite parking lot. Currently an empty brick building on Southern California Edison property.
